description: System-generated unique key for the part record used for internal identity and joins.
Business part number used to identify the item across purchasing, inventory, and maintenance.
Free-text item description shown on catalogs, purchase orders, and work orders.
Classification code grouping the item for inventory control, accounting, or reporting.
Flag indicating whether sales or use tax applies when the item is purchased or issued.
Lifecycle or availability code controlling whether the item can be ordered or issued.
Identifier of the parent item for kits/assemblies; blank when standalone. Likely supports bill-of-materials; confirm with SME.
Unit of measure used when issuing stock to work orders or departments.
Unit of measure used on vendor purchase orders for this item.
Multiplier converting purchase unit quantities to issue unit quantities.
Indicator whether the item is classified as hazardous, affecting storage, handling, shipping, and regulatory reporting.
Reference or link to the itemâ€™s safety data sheet (SDS/MSDS); confirm exact format and storage with SME.
Flag indicating the item is used as a component within a kit/assembly/BOM rather than standalone; confirm semantics with SME.
Tax code or group applied to the item for calculating applicable tax amounts; mapping may be system-defined; confirm with SME.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record, regardless of source.
Timestamp recorded for the last user-driven change to this record; may mirror system update time; confirm with SME.
User ID that originally created this record.
Timestamp when this record was first created.
User ID of the most recent person or process to modify this record.
Timestamp when the most recent user modification occurred.
